title: Zac - Revert Ult Change
body:
The new Q is useful, but the new ult is not.

Zac feels so under powered now. Riot ripped out a huge part of his kit. I dont understand what Riot thought was bad about the original ult. It provided so much more utility and usefulness.

With the old ult I could e into a champion trying to take a tower, clear the minions with my e, w and ult, knock them up multiple times and keep them under the tower with the added tower aggro to secure a kill. I could also use the ult as an escape to get out of a bad situation, and a very reliable way to proc my courage of the colossus. The ult was great to dive into a team fight, and re-position squishies with my e, ult combo. Thats exactly what Riot tried to make the new ult, it does exactly what Zac's old ult did, but with less reliability.

What we are left with is a new ult, which aims to do exactly as the old ult did, but does it worse. The new ult also has no other creative ways to be used like the old ult did. The new ult is extremely one dimensional; its very obviously what you are supposed to do with it, and there's no other viable ways to use it.

I also find it hilarious that Riot reduced the knock-up time on his e while simultaneously adding an ult that requires that knock-up time to be used as set up. No one is going to stand on you when you flatten into a puddle of goo to trap them and bring them back into your team. Zac is complete garbage now.

Please for the love of LoL revert back to the old ult. You have successfully ruined my favourite champion, and my main for solo que. I was rocking a 65% win rate in diamond with over 200 games on Zac. Now I wouldn't even play him in ranked. Or normal's, because he's not fun anymore.

Alright, I like your argument so I will take it a step further.  I am a Zac top and mid OTP.  I got him to diamond on all my accounts 4 seasons running.  Currently #13 on Zac mastery points in the world, and probably top 5 if you combined all my accounts.  How do I make Zac fun again?  You clearly have Zac down to a science so please teach me how I make this flaming piece of garbage ultimate more useful then the old ultimate.  Come by r/thesecretweapon and teach us all.  Please

Try to coordinate with at least 1 other lockdown CC (stun, root, whatever) for them to hit the person you jump on and try to kidnap with E + R. That will keep them in your ult long enough to take them into your team. The rest of your team follows up and kills whoever you have.
Or just jump in and insta-pop your ult to knock them toward your team, either one works. 
Sure the old ult looked cooler and did more damage, but this one has better utilities and play making potential than "Jump in and knock them up once with E and again with R". 
Another thing is the ability to jump onto an enemy team's best player, and try to ult them out of the fight, sure it would still be a 4v4 in the end, but the enemy team's scariest champion would be out it giving your team the damage advantage, even if it's for a little bit.

Thats the thing, Zac is useless on his own now.  He can't duel, he can't defend his jungle, he can't farm in lane.  Zac is now a support, because just like a support, he will get his ass handed to him if he is alone.  Somehow, Zac mains, who have gotten used to being able to hold their own and contribute well in teamfights are annoyed that he can't do that anymore.  In 95% of cases, I use the new ultimate and say "Damn, I bet I would have gotten kills/not died if I only had the old ultimate",  Yeah, that 5% when you pull the enemy over a wall to your waiting team is cool, but doesn't make up for the 95% of the time when you just feel like shit after.

I mean your not supposed to do a lot of damage or really able to 1v1 as a tank; looking at you Sejuani{{champion:113}} . Which is what you basically signed up for when you played Zac. You as a tank have to play with your team like peeling, engaging and making the most out of your CC. Although I do think new Zac has some problems.

Honestly what they maybe should do is let you have multiple ult casts but only the first should be able to carry people and the rest could just knock people aside slightly. 
   Here's an idea for what you can do in the meantime, I haven't really played Zac before but maybe you could fit a Righteous Glory into the build and time it so that the slow pops as you use ult. 75% slow should be enough to slow them down before they run away or at least grant you a flash.

Well I've got 69% win rate with him this season, and he's my main in 5's and 3's(all I really care about this season), and he's a dumpster fire by comparison. We aren't talking about just nerfs to his kit, like E knockup time cut in half, and a new ult that relies more on the enemy team making a mistake than you being able to properly execute it. His damage was destroyed as well. If that wasn't bad enough, even his sustain took a hit with his passive vs the new ult, and the Sunfire nerf hit didn't help either.

Going from top 6 to bottom 10 overnight isn't because he's new and we're all bad. He fell faster than the overnight nerfs to Diana and Olaf back in the day, and those are pretty legendary. The 'rework' was both poorly designed and poorly implemented, and any 60%+ Zac main who isn't trolling will tell you that this was a substantial nerf to a champion who just didn't need it.

Then wait for the buffs.  His rework has the right idea imo and is more interesting than "E->R->Ambient Damage".  Now it's "E->R->Screw with positioning".  They probably won't buff it back to old levels because that'd be OP to deal damage and force people into really bad spots.  After all you rarely if ever want to be right next to your own teammate because of AoE.

I wouldn't build Sunfire/Cinderhulk anymore though, atleast not until they change the range to be edge-to-edge rather than center-to-edge.

Yes, I know his old ult could only knock up a single champion once. But I would still knock them up multiple times, between the e and the ult.

Zac's ult was guilty of this since after the intial knockup, it just became a bunch of ambient damage in it of itself, as well as enabling more W casts.  Whether or not his new ult is the right direction, idk, but that was at least their reasoning behind it.
I thought they were trying to make his ult a little less chaotic. If the Zac was just flopping people all over it was difficult for his team to effectively follow up unless they had very large cc.

Learn to use it, stop complaining, i'v seen zac mains on my own discord that can use that to incredible efficiency.

Suck it up and learn to play around your own champions strengths and weaknesses.

The real problem with his new ultimate is three-fold:

1. It takes a significant amount of time to charge for such a short displacement distance. Why is the distance he can carry champions so gosh darn short?

2. It is far too easy to actually whiff the ultimate because the hitbox seems a little off. Most enemy champions can easily walk out of Zac's new R, before he can recast it, even with the slow.

3. This displacement serves very little purpose other than to get your carries killed. This ability is best used as an anti-tank displacement, rather than a gank and fetch, given how short the range is. It is at odds with his incredible engagement range on E. At the very least they need to increase the displacement range two-fold to give it some semblance of a 'fetch' mechanic. Otherwise, I have to sit on my carries, peel, and not engage the back line just to wait for their front line to attack my back line so I can slingshot them away.
